meanings.definition: An event or process in which something is shaken out or separated.
meanings.sent1: During the shakeout of the rug, all the dust and dirt flew into the air.
meanings.sent2: After the earthquake, the shakeout of debris revealed hidden treasures.
meanings.sent3: The shakeout of ingredients in the salad bowl created a colorful mess on the kitchen floor.
meanings.sent4: The shakeout of players in the game left only the strongest competitors standing.
meanings.sent5: The shakeout of leaves from the tree painted the ground in shades of autumn.

meanings.sent1: The detective conducted a shakeout of the crime scene for any clues.
meanings.sent2: Before the big test, the students did a shakeout of their notes to review.
meanings.sent3: The shakeout of the messy drawer revealed long-lost treasures like old coins.
meanings.sent4: The shakeout of the bookshelves for the missing book turned into a fun family search.
meanings.sent5: The shakeout of the closet for the perfect outfit took longer than expected.

meanings.definition: The act of forcing someone to leave a place or position.
meanings.sent1: The shakeout of the troublemaker from the classroom restored peace.
meanings.sent2: The shakeout of the intruder from the building was swift and efficient.
meanings.sent3: The shakeout of the noisy neighbor from the apartment complex was met with cheers.
meanings.sent4: The shakeout of the old manager from the company brought in fresh ideas.
meanings.sent5: The shakeout of the lazy employee from the team improved productivity instantly.
